channel.title: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?
channel.description:
So I’m testing out amuse and I make and then delete some projects just to see how it works, I don’t submit anything. They’re entirely blank projects. But somehow those apparently don’t get deleted, even though I tapped delete, and take up a few mb of space?
I’m confused. I’m very confused.

item.title: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?
item.dc:creator: HELIXX
item.description:
That doesn’t happen with me

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?
item.dc:creator: Maland2016
item.description:
Okay, they’re not projects, they’re releases. But when I delete a release, it seems to not go away because the number of megabytes just increases and I can’t fix it.

I dunno, maybe it will solve itself?

Read full topic
item.source: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?

item.title: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
Either you meant to type Auxy instead of amuse, or you are more confused than I can comprehend.

Amuse is a distribution service. There are no projects.

If, however, you’re talking about Auxy, then when you delete a project, there will always be a backup version in the “backups” section. Those take up some space.

Read full topic
item.source: Amuse [releases] take up a bit of storage?
